name: casita
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a small house, sometimes in the grounds (= the land and gardens surrounding a house) of a larger house: The little casita in the Spanish garden faces the main house. The resort has 210 casitas.
More examplesFewer examplesA twin-bed casita with ocean view is $545 a night.The house is decked out like a Mexican casita with bright colour washes, arched doorways and busy tiles.New additions include a three-bedroom guest casita, a wine-tasting room, and a six-car garage.
